wikipedia_page.main: John Mulcaster Carrick (1833 – 22 September 1896) was a British painter, etcher, and illustrator. He painted in the Pre-Raphaelite style.

response: **The Great King's Final Battle (illustrated by John Mulcaster Carrick) (pg.132)

His son, John Mulcaster Carrick (1833–1896) was a landscape and figure painter.Carlisle-born talent spotted by Ruskin  (The Cumberland News, 30 July 2010). Among Carrick's pupils was landscape artist John Henry Mole (1814–1886).J H Mole (John Nicholson Fine Art)
